title: From which book should I build my physics concepts when I am not able to understand HC Verma? - Quora

response.answer_text: See first of all , there is nothing to worry about if you are unable to understand HCV . Infact , it is quite normal . If you ask for that one single book which will clear all your concepts , then sorry , even I failed to find one such for myself . Supposing , you are facing the concepts for the first time with no idea of basics , I would suggest you to start with nootan . That book is good only for school level and would in no way help you build the concepts . But , definitely when you start solving the basic questions , you will gain confidence. That is the reason , why many go for Universal self scorer also. In the next step , go for D C Pandey . One of the best books one can afford ! If you have some teacher to guide , then do take his help to understand the basic idea behind every question ( instead of just applying formulae) .Clear all ur doubts. Only then , jump on to HCV. In that too , you may find the theory to be a bit complex . But then again , NO NEED TO WORRY . You actually don't need theory for physics. Consult the questions only . Think and imagine . HOPE THAT HELPS . CHEERS!

See my dear If you begin studying physics from HC VERMA there is hardly any probability that you will understand the concepts. This book is good for questions only. But to solve the questions you have to be good in theory and for that youcan start from SL Arora, Pradeep, coaching notes. hope you can make it
